Esophagitis can be caused by a number of factors, including acid reflux, infection, allergies, medications and irritants.

Esophagitis is diagnosed by a doctor who will perform a physical exam and ask about the patient's medical history. Cardiomyopathy is a disease of the heart muscle that causes the heart to become enlarged, thickened or rigid. Arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy is characterized by an enlarged right ventricle that is unable to pump blood efficiently.
